intro: Palafoxia rosea var. robusta, commonly known as the robust palafoxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, rose-like flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a rough texture, and it produces clusters of pink to reddish-purple flowers. It is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ecological benefits and adaptability to aquatic environments.
